page.title: 10HERSDEN
page.content: Hersden was built as homes for the miners of Chislet Colliery. The mine was closed in 1969 so now miners who live in the village travel to other pits in the Kent coal field and there are many families who have no connection with mining. The site of Chislet Colliery is being developed as an industrial park. The Miners Welfare is still in the village and was busy during the miners strike of 1984-85 serving meals to children and distributing food gifts. There is a modern primary school with 120 pupils The doctor's surgery has a dispensary as there is no chemists shop nearer than Sturry. There are 2 churches; one Roman Catholic and one Methodist. The Methodist Church is used jointly by Methodists and Anglicans as part of an ecumenical group which also includes Sturry and Westbere.
